screens.headline: Ready to Trade REAL Money? (The 10-Point Checklist)

cards.definition: You understand options mechanics, Greeks, strategies, risk management, taxes
cards.example: Can explain: bid-ask spreads, early assignment risk, gamma explosion, rolling positions, buying power requirements

cards.term: âœ… Practice: 30+ paper trades over 30+ days
cards.definition: Minimum practice requirement to see different market conditions
cards.example: Traded through: up days, down days, choppy markets, high/low volatility. Tested your discipline over time.

cards.term: âœ… Results: Net positive paper trading P/L
cards.definition: Proven edge in simulation before risking real capital
cards.example: 30 trades, 18 wins, 12 losses = 60% win rate, +$2,400 profit. OR 40% win rate but winners 3x bigger than losers.

cards.term: âœ… Discipline: Followed trading plan 90%+ of time
cards.definition: Can stick to your rules even when emotions say otherwise
cards.example: Didn't FOMO into trades outside plan. Took stop losses when triggered. Didn't overtrade after wins/losses.

cards.term: âœ… Plan: Written trading plan with specific entry/exit rules
cards.definition: Clear rules for: what to trade, position sizing, entry criteria, exit criteria, max risk per trade
cards.example: I sell 30-45 DTE CSPs on quality stocks, 5-8% OTM, max 3% account risk, close at 50% profit or -100% loss.

cards.term: âœ… Journal: Logged every paper trade with notes
cards.definition: Data-driven approach, learning from wins AND losses
cards.example: Each trade logged: strategy, entry/exit, P/L, what worked, what didn't, emotions felt, lessons learned.

cards.term: âœ… Platform: Approved for strategies you'll use (Level 2-3)
cards.definition: Broker account ready, options approval granted, familiar with platform
cards.example: TD Ameritrade Level 3 approved. Know how to: place limit orders, close spreads, roll positions, check buying power.

cards.term: âœ… Capital: 3-6 months emergency fund SEPARATE from trading
cards.definition: Only trade with risk capital you can afford to lose completely
cards.example: $25K trading account + $20K emergency fund in savings. Losing trading account won't affect rent, food, bills.

cards.term: âœ… Psychology: Can explain every position to a friend
cards.definition: No mystery trades, no FOMO, no hope-trading
cards.example: Why this trade? What's my thesis? Max risk? Max gain? Exit plan? If you can't explain it simply, don't trade it.

cards.term: âœ… Acceptance: Understand risk of total loss + ready to start SMALL
cards.definition: Starting with 1 contract, scaling up gradually over months
cards.example: First 10 trades = 1 contract max. After success, increase to 2 contracts. After 20 more trades, increase again. Patience!

screens.question: You checked 8/10 boxes on the checklist. Should you start trading real money?
screens.explanation_correct: ALL 10 required! Missing ANY box = not ready. This isn't school where 80% passes. Real money = real consequences. Each box protects you from specific failure mode. Missing 'Discipline'? You'll blow up account. Missing 'Emergency Fund'? One bad month forces panic selling. 10/10 or keep practicing!
screens.explanation_wrong: You need 10/10 - no exceptions. Each requirement protects against specific risks: Knowledge (bad trades), Practice (no experience), Results (no edge), Discipline (emotion trading), Plan (no rules), Journal (can't improve), Platform (can't execute), Capital (financial stress), Psychology (confusion), Acceptance (unrealistic expectations). Miss one = vulnerable!

screens.question: You hit 10/10 on checklist. How should you start trading real money?
options: Jump to full position sizes - you're ready!
Start with 1 contract, prove you can handle emotions, scale slowly
Wait another 30 days just to be safe
screens.explanation_correct: Perfect discipline! Paper trading success â‰  real money success. Emotions change EVERYTHING when it's real. Start 1 contract. After 10-20 successful real trades (following plan, managing emotions), increase to 2 contracts. Scale up every 20 trades. Take 3-6 months to reach full size. Patience = survival!
screens.explanation_wrong: Real money feels different - fear, greed, panic hit harder. Start with 1 contract minimum size. Prove you can handle real money psychology for 10-20 trades. THEN scale up slowly (2 contracts, then 3, then 4). Reaching full size should take 3-6 months. Rushing = common reason beginners blow up accounts!
